density characteristics of montmorillonite has a signiﬁcant inﬂuence on its hydration characteristics
In this work, the molecular dynamics simulation software was used to study the inﬂuence

, we can also ﬁnd that the layer charge density of montmorillonite
ect on the distribution of water molecules in interlayer. When the charge density is
low(such as M1), the water molecules are mainly distributed near the central axis, which is shown as

. With the increase of charge density (such as M2 and M3), the main
peaks on both sides of the central axis begin to split, and at the same time, the peaks get weaker. When
the charge density increases to 0.688 (such as M4), two new peaks begin to form near about –2.5 Å

. The reason is that with the increase of the charge density, more and
more hydrogen atoms in the water molecules turn to the Si-O surface, the number of hydrogen bonds
